answers.answer: Does she go outside alot? she could be hunting her food

What are you feeding her and exactly how much are you feeding her?  Any treats?  Could anyone else be feeding her in your home?  Please, let us know these things and we can help you figure out what's going on.I would also suggest taking your cat to the vet to check on the possibility of another condition causing your cat to gain weight.  There might be something going on, but I am willing to bet that it's an easy fix!!!

I agree with ZQ.  She is either eating more than you know, or she may have a metabolic disorder that causes her to store too much food as body fat.  You need to investigate the former and if she is truly not overeating, have a vet check for metabolic issues.

question: My cat is 1 1/2 years old, and she is so overweight, she can't even lick herself appropriately.  She does not nor has ever over ate.  I have always measured out her food portions.  I'm wondering if she has a medical issue...diabetes, thyroid problems or what else at her age?  Any suggestions?
title: fat cat
